frameDefinitions: A Speaker conveys a Message to an Experiencer in order to reassure them about a Situation; Medium and the Means of the communication also may be expressed.
A Question about the reason or cause of a known State_of_affairs is presented as being answered by the existence of a particular Fact.
Using Evidence, which may or may not be expressed, a Cognizer recognizes or proves that Concept1 is associated causally or collocationally with another concept, Concept2.

The answer to one open question, the Outcome, is dictated (partially or completely) by the answer to another open question, the Determinant, i.e. if the answer to the Determinant is known, the answer to the Outcome can be predicted.
A concept, Concept_1, is related causally or collocationally to another concept, Concept_2 by means of some evidence.
frameExamples: We <t>reassured</t> him that his decision was sound.
Ruby's orange vest marked with the words 'service dog' <t>accounts</t> for why the 3-year-old goes along.
Economic policy is partially a <t>function</t> of cultural values.
listRoleDefinitions: The sentient entity that uses language in the written or spoken modality to reassure another person.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> receives reassurance from the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Message</fen> is a proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Speaker</fen> wants the <fen>Experiencer</fen> to believe in order to feel reassured.
The <fen>Situation</fen> is the problem plaguing the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, about which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  reassures them.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the reassurance takes place.
A force, process, or event that produces an effect.
Agents in a joint or reciprocal action (e.g. exchange)
A positive or negative evaluation of the Phenomenon.
An entity which participates in a <fen>Cause</fen>, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
A <fen>Fact</fen> which can be connected by a chain of reasoning to the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
A <fen>Fact</fen> whose cause is under consideration.
An open proposition concerning the cause of the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
<fen>Concept1</fen> is the phenomenon which is believed to be related to <fen>Concept2</fen>.
The phenomenon which is believed to be linked to Concept1.
The sentient entity that recognizes the causal connection.
The phenomena which are believed to be related.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> make the connection.
The location where the Cognizer makes the connection.
An open question that is (to some degree) predictable from the Determinant.
An open question that determines the <fen>Outcome</fen>.
The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.  Generally expressed as the external argument.
The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.  Generally expressed as a PP complement.
The two concepts expressed jointly.
listRoleExamples: <fex>He</fex> reassured her that she was his favorite ice-skating star.
He tried to reassure <fex>his potential customers</fex> that his company not only offered the best service, but also the most competitive prices.
How do you reassure them <fex>that you really like them</fex>?
The policeman reassured him <fex>about the safety of the neighborhood</fex>.
<fex>That one stone</fex>, apparently, caused the avalanche that engulfed square miles of forest.
<fex>This fact</fex> alone explains the Sun/climate anomaly.
Do increased proinsulin concentrations explain <fex>the excess risk of coronary heart disease in diabetic and prediabetic subjects</fex>?
The fact that this remained in Pandora's box explains <fex>why men have hope</fex>.
Price, in such a case, depends <fex>only on the whim of the supplier</fex>.
